text:
Trust in Jesus, Hell is real and eternal! This is what the Bible says about it.. 
"The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his kingdom everything that causes sin and all who do evil. They will throw them into the blazing furnace, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth." Matthew 13: 41-42
Jesus Christ is the only way to heaven "I am the way, the truth, and the life no one comes to the father but by me."  John 14:6   Ask God to reveal this to you- He will! 
"For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God." Romans 3:23 ADMIT THAT YOU'RE A SINNER. We've all broken God's laws and ten commandments.. "Thou shalt not lie, steal, covet, dishonor parents, take God's name in vain.."(Exodus 20) We do not have righteousness on our own to get to heaven, "God made him (Jesus) who had no sin to be sin for us, so that in him we might become the righteousness of God." 2 Cor. 5:21 Godly sorrow leads to genuine repentance for sinning against the righteous God and there is a change of heart, we change our mind and God changes our hearts and regenerates us from the inside out. God is deadly serious about sin, when we genuinely repent we hate sin just as God hates it, and we turn away from it.
"But God commended His love toward us, in that while we were yet sinners Christ died for us." Romans 5:8 BELIEVE IN YOUR HEART THAT JESUS CHRIST DIED FOR YOUR SINS, WAS BURIED, AND THAT GOD RAISED JESUS FROM THE DEAD. This is trusting with all of your heart that Jesus Christ is who he said he was. He saves us from sin and hell and brings us into a relationship with him. We become God's children. We are saved from hell, eternal death.
"For whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved." Romans 10:13 CALL UPON THE NAME OF THE LORD. Every single person who ever lived since Adam will bend their knee and confess with their mouth that Jesus Christ is Lord, the Lord of Lords and the King of Kings.
Read the Bible, Walk with the Lord and give your life to Him!

text:
Thank you for your love Ed!  
I can hear  & feel it in nearly every of your songs. And however… it's  soo helpful!  
I lost my "husband /bestfriend/love" in 2019. He just felt over… and was gone… totally out of the blue… and seriously,   It doesn't hurt less after some years.  Just,  life is more around me, surrounding me. But inside it is still the same deep pain.  No doubt, if one half of your heart is gone the second piece has to  work harder. (Probably a German phrase ;-) 
Your music is a real comfort in silent sad moments. Almost like a quick therapy. 
When I allow myself to cry.  

THANKYOUVERYMUCH 💛

text: The love of my life and my children's daddy got murdered by our local hospital. declared dead when he wasnt and left to incur serious brain injury after leaving him without medical attention IN THEIR HOSPITAL ROOM, repeatedly telling us he was dead for 7 HOURS, to only then realise, oops hes not. which left him with a 6 month battle to live in a broken body which he never gave up trying to fix.  until pneumonia took him on the 9th may, again due to our hospitals overuse of antibiotics which made him resistant to all types. This song feels like I wrote it, every single word is what I feel. Even down to the words "I pictured this year a little bit different when it hit February". February was when he got transferred to a neuro rehabilitation centre, and we thought this was the break he needed. But the hospital had let him down so badly over the 3 months he was there that his body was near unfixable by the time he arrived.
author: Rosie Hewson

text: Lost my dad in the end of January 2010. I was 19... never could put into words how that felt. How it still feels. Just kept painting like a crazy person and composing music. And then almost every year after that, lost another father figure. Uncles, dad's friends, my professors, almost my mom. This whole album sums that up pretty damn well. Felt this in my soul. Masterpiece of an album. Beautiful song

text: I listened to this song every day for the last 72 days that my baby girl was kept away from me. I fought tooth and nail in court and the judge held her mother in contempt for keeping her from me out of vengeance. I cried almost every day listening to this but it gave me the power and will to get through one of the hardest times of my life. Now I'm on my way to pick up my baby girl and hold her in my arms once again.

text: I lost my Dad six years ago and this song epitomizes how I still feel all these years later.  I don’t go a day without still being able to see him as if he was still here.  What makes it even harder is that a week and a half ago my family lost our family dog who was just as close to him as the actual family was.  We all felt like that little guy Trigger carried a piece of dad’s soul all these years later, so it feels like that wound just got ripped right back open.  Nevertheless you have to find a way to keep going and songs like this really help remind me of that.  I’ve always appreciated your music Ed but this song I would have to say is my favorite, other than shivers and bad habits.  Thank you for always putting out amazing content we as your audience love.
author: Paul Meyer

text: This song is so true for me.   Everytime I listen to this makes the pain worse, but it's such a beautiful song .This is my story : I lost my beautiful Husband Troy in February 2023... I don't know how I could ever feel any happiness again. We were married 20 years in December 2022. Luckily we made It to our 20th Wedding Anniversary. My darling was only 53 years old... He was so very sick with lung cancer but we were under the belief that he had more time. He died a horrific painful death very suddenly and cruely.. Some days I can smile and live but most of the time I'm just existing.. I don't want to be here anymore... All I have left is my Dad who is 80 years old and sick... As soon as he is gone I pray to the Lord to take me to my baby.. Please, Lord..
author: Susan Paterson

Will you sink into ever more guilt and shame ridden states? Or will you find something deep inside to find the strength to desist from your spiritually deadly self- deception and at least tey to work your way into the peomised land as opposed to that *other place*
author: lisa oconnor

text: Don McLean asked us if music can save our mortal souls. Yes, Ed, it can. If that is what you choose, it is yours. If you choose to address the spiritual harm you did. you will immediately feel teemenous  relief.
author: lisa oconnor

text: So Ed, your skills as an artist are astonishingly important-- not just impressive, but important. I wish you could see what I know :( The meanings you convey are multi-layered and quite sophisticated. The pain coming thru you is real and your own music telling you this is. Powerful stuff. The highly advance musical communication you are capable of is an asset way beyond the obvious. It is your soul trying to understand and interpret the subconscious machinations going on inside, so you can get to the bottom of things to get them fixed.
author: lisa oconnor

text: 1)   Ed Sheeran is in the top 1% of musican geniouses. Next: Ed, your agonizing pain has an origin. And you and I both know what it is. You went down a path, Ed, a very regretable one. And you spend your time wishing and singing about the misery it brought you, instead of fixing the karmic mess you made of your existence.. Why not address what you and I both know happened? Because Ed, it is killing you psychologically.
author: lisa oconnor

text: I lost my husband to cancer in January and this song just reached down into my grief like a hand. He passed away two days shy of what would have been our 30th wedding anniversary and some days I feel like I am doing exactly what you sing about. I still see him, feel him, everywhere. Our daughter has always been a big fan of yours, and she introduced me to your music. What you write and sing about touches people deeply. You are such an intuitive singer/songwriter and your songs are full of raw emotion, and evoke the same. My daughter and son-in-law even used your song Perfect for their wedding song, as it really does describe the love they have together (they have been a couple since they were 15, married 5 years yesterday, and now have a beautiful little girl, 2 years old). As much as this song made me cry, I know I need to let it out, and it's so beautiful, even as it is heartwrenching. It is the mark of true talent to be able to evoke so many different emotions in your fans. Thank you for sharing your gift with us all.❤
author: Moreen Brooks

text: Wonderful Ed, You were born on the anniversary of my brothers passing!   And today... we are grieving instead of celebrating my Nephews 25th birthday!   Ed... YOU are a spiritual giant to help us heal as many of us grieve!  This song.... and your "Sum" of All Things" is SO VERY cathartic and healing for me... For my family!  We lost our 24 y.o. son/nephew, Bridger, 8 mos. ago!  He took his own life!  My other son was the last to be with him....     THIS soulful, deep heartfelt, raw, kind, wise, generous, vulnerable, honest music from your heart 'in' your own grieving has given me... And our family, a strength, even a unity with another precious soul,  YOU!   You have expressed with your body and music the pains we are feeling!  I feel  hope BECAUSE you let us know and experience that we are not alone in these feelings... in this grief... in the tears!!                                          Thanks for being true to the divine gifts that are yours as you lift this grieving world to a higher hope!  AND.... now,  take care of yourself and your family as you continue the important path you are on!       I pray perfect fitting blessings for you and your family in this year of 'firsts' without your brother J. E.       I wish we were neighbors... my gr gr gr grandparents and family lived in Hastings and other parts of Essex!   I wish we could have a joined family woodland or mountain picnic with you and yours to share in this journey together!     Bridger's sister and her husband were at your cowboy stadium American tour opening concert!   They LOVED YOU AND YOUR MUSIC SO VERY MUCH!!  And they cried with you.    THANKS for being on earth at this time...    WE ALL  need you!     LT
author: Lanette Thorpe

text: I LOVE Ed Sheeran so much!  Can't wait for the day that I can see him in concert.  I recently watched his documentary and found myself crying right along with him when he broke down crying at one of his performances over his dear friend's death.  It's ok Ed, people get it and you.  You are human and the performance was even better showing your emotions.  I lost both my parents (who were also my best friends) within the last 2 years.  UGH  Between last month and this month, I experienced Mother's Day, my Mom's 2 year death anniversary, my Mom's birthday, Father's Day, and my Dad's 1 year death anniversary without them.  I heard this song on the radio today and found myself dancing with my eyes closed while crying.  At the same time, I felt my Mom's strong presence and knew she was dancing right along beside me (as she often did while she was living).  Loved it and love your music!!!  Thank you
